channel.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:18, topic:423609”][quote author=collin123456 link=topic=526234.msg3833108#msg3833108 date=1322705873]

aww, thanks, i feel stupid, now i get a nullpointer/dc when i click on the npc lmfao, this is fun…

Probably because there’s no Npc at index 9462.

what exactly do you mean by that? i clicked npc 9462 and got a nullpoint.dced instead of it transforming into 9463

Although you clicked Npc 9462, you are trying to get the Npc through the NpcHandler. What this means is that just because you clicked Npc 9462, the 9462nd index of the Npcs[] is null.

Analogous to

final Npc[] npcs = new Npc[10000];
npcs[0] = new Npc(15);
npcs[1] = new Npc(9462);
npcs[2] = new Npc(4);
// ...
npcs[9462] = null;

if you told me which files you need it would you be able to do it to show me what your talking about? im still a noob learning lol
[/quote]

I wont do anything for you. Neither should anyone else.

If you don’t understand the concept of arrays and indexes, then you should go read the Java tutorial before you even think about continuing.[/quote]
fair enough
thanks for your help

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:17, topic:423609”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=526234.msg3832998#msg3832998 date=1322702324]

aww, thanks, i feel stupid, now i get a nullpointer/dc when i click on the npc lmfao, this is fun…

Probably because there’s no Npc at index 9462.

what exactly do you mean by that? i clicked npc 9462 and got a nullpoint.dced instead of it transforming into 9463

Although you clicked Npc 9462, you are trying to get the Npc through the NpcHandler. What this means is that just because you clicked Npc 9462, the 9462nd index of the Npcs[] is null.

Analogous to

final Npc[] npcs = new Npc[10000];
npcs[0] = new Npc(15);
npcs[1] = new Npc(9462);
npcs[2] = new Npc(4);
// ...
npcs[9462] = null;

[/quote]

if you told me which files you need it would you be able to do it to show me what your talking about? im still a noob learning lol[/quote]

I wont do anything for you. Neither should anyone else.

If you don’t understand the concept of arrays and indexes, then you should go read the Java tutorial before you even think about continuing.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:16, topic:423609”][quote author=collin123456 link=topic=526234.msg3832952#msg3832952 date=1322701380]

aww, thanks, i feel stupid, now i get a nullpointer/dc when i click on the npc lmfao, this is fun…

Probably because there’s no Npc at index 9462.

what exactly do you mean by that? i clicked npc 9462 and got a nullpoint.dced instead of it transforming into 9463
[/quote]

Although you clicked Npc 9462, you are trying to get the Npc through the NpcHandler. What this means is that just because you clicked Npc 9462, the 9462nd index of the Npcs[] is null.

Analogous to

final Npc[] npcs = new Npc[10000]; npcs[0] = new Npc(15); npcs[1] = new Npc(9462); npcs[2] = new Npc(4); // ... npcs[9462] = null; [/quote]

if you told me which files you need it would you be able to do it to show me what your talking about? im still a noob learning lol

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:15, topic:423609”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=526234.msg3832924#msg3832924 date=1322700760]

aww, thanks, i feel stupid, now i get a nullpointer/dc when i click on the npc lmfao, this is fun…

Probably because there’s no Npc at index 9462.
[/quote]
what exactly do you mean by that? i clicked npc 9462 and got a nullpoint.dced instead of it transforming into 9463[/quote]

Although you clicked Npc 9462, you are trying to get the Npc through the NpcHandler. What this means is that just because you clicked Npc 9462, the 9462nd index of the Npcs[] is null.

Analogous to

final Npc[] npcs = new Npc[10000];
npcs[0] = new Npc(15);
npcs[1] = new Npc(9462);
npcs[2] = new Npc(4);
// ...
npcs[9462] = null;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:11, topic:423609”][code]public void firstClickNpc(int npcType) {
c.fishitem = -1;
c.clickNpcType = 0;
c.npcClickIndex = 0;
if (c.fishitem != -1) {
if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.fishitem)) {
c.sendMessage("You need a " + c.getItems().getItemName(c.fishitem) + " to fish for " + c.getItems().getItemName(c.fishies));
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
c.sendMessage(“Your inventory is full.”);
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
if (c.playerFishing < c.fishreqt) {
c.sendMessage(“You need a fishing level of " + c.fishreqt + " to fish here.”);
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
c.fishtimer = c.getFishing().fishtime(c.fishies, c.fishreqt);
}
switch(npcType) {

	case 9462:
	NPCHandler.ice(i);
	break;

	case 212:
	c.getPA().showInterface(15060);
	break;
	
	case 659:
    	c.getDH().sendDialogues(608, npcType);//dicing
     	break;
	
	case 2244:
		c.getPA().showInterface(26099);
			c.getPA().sendFrame200(26101, 9847);//chatid
			c.getPA().sendFrame185(26101);
			if (c.KC > c.DC) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @gre@" +c.KC+" ", 26105);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @red@"+c.DC+"", 26106);
			}
			if (c.KC < c.DC) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @red@"+c.KC+"", 26105);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @gre@"+c.DC+"", 26106);
			}
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+c.playerName+"", 26107);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Combat Level: @gre@"+c.combatLevel+"", 26108);
				if (c.playerRights == 1) {
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Moderator", 26109);
				}
				if (c.playerRights == 2) {
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Web Designer", 26109);
				}
				if (c.playerRights == 3) {
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Owner", 26109);
				}
				if (c.playerRights == 0) {
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Player", 26109);
				}
				if (c.playerRights == 4) {
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Donator", 26109);
				}
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Dung Points: @gre@" +c.dungPoints+" ", 26111);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Pk points: @gre@"+c.pkPoints+"  ", 26113);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Barrow Points: @gre@-", 26115);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Pest Points: @gre@"+c.pcPoints+"  ", 26116);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Assault Points: @gre@-", 26117);
			
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Gambles Won: @gre@-", 26118);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Gambles Lost: @gre@-", 26119);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Battles Won: @gre@-", 26120);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Battles Lost: @gre@-", 26121);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@NPC Kills: @gre@-", 26122);
			c.updateRequired = true;
			c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		break;
		case 875:
			if(c.absX > 2816 && c.absX < 2880 && c.absY > 2944 && c.absY < 3007) {
		c.getShops().openPlayerShop(c);
		} else {
		c.sendMessage("You can only view your shops in home.");
		}
		break;
		case 2127:
		if(c.playerCollect > 0){
		c.sendMessage("You succesfully collected "+c.playerCollect+" coins.");
		c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerCollect);
		c.playerCollect = 0;
		}else{
		c.sendMessage("You dont have anything to collect");
		}
		break;
	
		case 706:
			c.getDH().sendDialogues(9, npcType);
		break;
		case 7601:
			c.getDH().sendDialogues(70, 4289);
		break;
		case 6794:
		case 6873:
		c.getDH().sendDialogues(75, 4289);
		break;

case 946:
c.getDH().sendDialogues(20, npcType);
break;
case 316:
c.fishing = true;
c.fishXP = 350;
c.fishies = 317;
c.fishreqt = 0;

case 3100:

case 4289:

		case 2259:

		break;

		case 8275:

		break;
		case 793:
			c.getShops().openShop(83);
			//c.getPA().showInterface(18070);

//c.getPA().sendFrame126(""+c.dungPoints+"", 18071);
//c.sendMessage(“You currently have <col=255>” + c.dungPoints + " Dungeoneering Points.");
break;

[/code]

is where the error is coming from in there[/quote]

As I said before, there is no variable i

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

[code]public void firstClickNpc(int npcType) {
c.fishitem = -1;
c.clickNpcType = 0;
c.npcClickIndex = 0;
if (c.fishitem != -1) {
if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.fishitem)) {
c.sendMessage("You need a " + c.getItems().getItemName(c.fishitem) + " to fish for " + c.getItems().getItemName(c.fishies));
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
c.sendMessage(“Your inventory is full.”);
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
if (c.playerFishing < c.fishreqt) {
c.sendMessage(“You need a fishing level of " + c.fishreqt + " to fish here.”);
c.fishing = false;
return;
}
c.fishtimer = c.getFishing().fishtime(c.fishies, c.fishreqt);
}
switch(npcType) {

	case 9462:
	NPCHandler.ice(i);
	break;

	case 212:
	c.getPA().showInterface(15060);
	break;
	
	case 659:
    	c.getDH().sendDialogues(608, npcType);//dicing
     	break;
	
	case 2244:
		c.getPA().showInterface(26099);

case 9462: NPCHandler.ice(i); break;
is where the error is coming from in there

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:8, topic:423609”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=526234.msg3832865#msg3832865 date=1322699239]

public static void ice(int i) {
NPCHandler.npcs[i].requestTransform(9463);
}

thanks that part worked, now on the clicking npc i need to figure out how to make it stop saying unknown variable i

Well in the switch statement, you are calling the method with variable i, but it probably doesn’t exist. It’s probably something like npcId or something similar.

hmmm…maybe i will have to keep trying, no matter what i do i get an error

Then post the error, and the code that you’re using and maybe someone can help. Due to the lack of information at my disposal, I’m going on previous experience and the information you’ve given me.
[/quote]

the code is:

case 9462: NPCHandler.ice(i); break;
and

public static void ice(int i) { NPCHandler.npcs[i].requestTransform(9463); }

the error is that the variable I is unknown[/quote]

In which case? The first part or the second? What are the other cases in the switch? Are there any? Is i the correct variable name? Or is it something else?

Read full topic

Well in the switch statement, you are calling the method with variable i, but it probably doesn’t exist. It’s probably something like npcId or something similar.

item.title: [PI] strykewyrm help rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:1, topic:423609”]i have:

case 9462: NPCHandler.ice(i); break;
in clicknpc.java
and

public void ice(int i) { NPCHandler.npcs[i].requestTransform(9463); }
that in npchandler.java
but when i compile i get an error about variable i and that “non-static method ice(int) cannot be referenced from a static context”
can somebody help me figure this out and get it working? im sooo confused lol, thanks and i will rep whoever helps fix[/quote]

You declared it as public void ice, and are trying to access it statically.

You need to add the static keyword to the method.

Read full topic
